result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan J Pokorny was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Court ordered to be served straight time. No release privileges.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both, unless in an inpatient treatment facility.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments. Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes probation.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
Imposed and STAYED. Consecutive. To be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 5 days for the first violation, 10 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation. Review hearing 7-11-14, 8:30 a.m.

***October 9, 2014/Judge C. Fiorenza/ORDER FOR COMMITMENT FOR NON-COMPLIANCE WITH PROBATION CONDITIONS...to serve 5 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME IN hoc.***

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathan J Pokorny in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
Case scheduled for probation review hearing.  Defendant is doing well, and complying with conditions of probation.  NO further reviews needed.  aw
Probation review report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Nathan J Pokorny in court with attorney Christina Ballisteri for attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  Defendant has completed community service, is working, and is enrolled in school.  Defendant to be in some type of aftercare.  Case adjourned to 5/4/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 3.  aw
Probation review report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Nathan J Pokorny in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 5 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.  Defendant to do communtiy service, and look for a job.
Case adjourned to 1/7/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 3.  aw  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Probation review hearing, received and filed.  aw
Court contacted attorney Pecora.  Case adjourned for probation review hearing on 10/9/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Agent requests case adjourned.  Defendant to start treatment on 7/21/2014.  Clerk will contact attorney Pecora to reschedule probation review.  aw
Also referenced ATN #41171402090013, arrest date 2-9-14, WAPD.
Drug tests results, and record of fees paid for counseling, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Nathan J Pokorny in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 0 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 45 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 5 days for the first violation, 10 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both, unless in an inpatient treatment facility.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 40 hours of community service.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

CASE ADJOURNED FOR PROBATION REVIEW HEARING ON 7/11/2014 AT 8:30 AM, BRANCH 3.  

Court will grant EXPUNGEMENT, if defendant successfully completes probation.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Nathan J Pokorny in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defense counsel informs this court that case may resolve in a DPA.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 6/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nathan J Pokorny in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nathan J Pokorny in court with attorney Christopher Hartley for attorney Mark Pecora.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 3.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3-26-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
